column5: Looking to launch on Pigeon this Wednesday and I'm wondering where to launch as many marinas are under water.
Not sure but Gannon Narrows Marina has a good slope to concrete launch. Maybe call them.
Not sure but Gannon Narrows Marina has a good slope to concrete launch. Maybe call them.

We use the public launch on Bass Lake Rd just outside of Bobcaygeon . Not much parking but the launch is Ok we have a 19 1/2 ft Bass tracker and launch no problem . Its also on the north end a couple mins from Big Island
Not sure but Gannon Narrows Marina has a good slope to concrete launch. Maybe call them.  I called, no answer.

We use the public launch on Bass Lake Rd just outside of Bobcaygeon . Not much parking but the launch is Ok we have a 19 1/2 ft Bass tracker and launch no problem . Its also on the north end a couple mins from Big Island  Is there a dock? I usually launch solo.

Yes, there is a dock, but it may not be there right now.  I usually launch in bobcaygeon. Go over the bridge, first right on anne st, follow to the water. There is usually a dock there too, but the water is so high right now, I don't know if it will be in. I haven't been on pigeon yet.  S.
the dock in town in caygeon at the launch is not in yet
2 days ago the launch was underwater and the river is almost on the road there in that spot
Maybe the whole Marina is under water!?!?! Oh my!!!
The one on Bass Lake Rd has a small dock . A friend from another board used it yesterday said he got his feet wet getting to it so the water is up some there also but he launched OK

The one on Bass Lake Rd has a small dock . A friend from another board used it yesterday said he got his feet wet getting to it so the water is up some there also but he launched OK  Thank you.  I always have a pair of wellington's on hand just for that
Didn't know why I bought hip boots 5-6 years ago put I do now.  Wore then all day tues in the boat. Very comfortable.
